chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Marie Drost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any treatment deemed necessary by Agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jennifer Marie Drost in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to both counts, Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation, consecutive to 13CF801, with conditions:  complete any treatment deemed necessary by agent; DOC to collect costs; no sentence credit.  Deportation warning given.

Defendant Jennifer Marie Drost in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed; Copy to Defendant; Reading waived.  Not guilty plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jennifer Marie Drost in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely & voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver & binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jennifer Marie Drost in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed; Copy to Deft; Penalties advised; Rights given; Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014, at 1:45 pm.
